movies.title: The Violin Case Murders
movies.plot: The first Jerry Cotton movie is a good one. Jerry's after crooks who pose as a musical band. He infiltrates the gang, cozying up to their gun moll boss and trying to find out what she knows. What's in their violin cases? Great opening titles. Cool movie. B&W, scope, 35mm.
movies.simplePlot: The first Jerry Cotton movie is a good one. Jerry's after crooks who pose as a musical band. He infiltrates the gang, cozying up to their gun moll boss and trying to find out what she knows...

biography.bio: Born in Pasadena, California, George Nader became interested in acting while still in school and appeared in several productions at the Pasadena Playhouse. This led to several small parts in movies before earning the lead role in the infamous 3D thriller Robot Monster (1953). The movie was bad but profitable, and Nader soon had a contract with Universal Pictures. Unfortunately, the studio already had on its roster such good-looking and athletic actors as Rock Hudson, Tony Curtis and Jeff Chandler, so Nader often found himself being cast in their leftovers, usually playing parts that emphasized his "beefcake" appeal. (At 6' 1" and 180 pounds, Nader had the kind of physique fan magazines drooled over and unlike many of his colleagues, he frequently appeared with his chest hair intact.) However, he did enjoy a few good years in the mid-1950s, turning in a commendable performance in Away All Boats (1956) before his career began to decline. He tried his hand at three TV series and then relocated to Europe, where he enjoyed a modest revival in the late 1960s starring as "Jerry Cotton" in a series of West German films.
biography.name: George Nader

biography.bio: Heinz Weiss was born on June 12, 1921 in Stuttgart, Germany. He was an actor, known for The Great Escape (1963), Das Traumschiff (1981) and As Far as My Feet Will Carry Me (1959). He was married to Elfriede. He died on November 20, 2010 in Grünwald, Munich, Germany.
biography.name: Heinz Weiss

biography.bio: Sylvia Pascal is an actress, known for The Violin Case Murders (1965), Le chien fou (1966) and I racconti del maresciallo (1968).
biography.name: Sylvia Pascal

biography.bio: Helga Schlack was born on October 12, 1938 in Berlin, Germany. She is an actress, known for And Saucy at That (1960), Theorie und Praxis (1962) and Das kleine Wunder (1961). She was previously married to Peer Schmidt.
biography.name: Helga Schlack

biography.bio: Helmut Förnbacher was born on January 26, 1936 in Basel, Switzerland. He is an actor and director, known for Youth (2015), Chasse aux renards interdite (1966) and Beyond Control (1968). He has been married to Kristina Nel since 1975.
biography.name: Helmut Förnbacher

biography.bio: Philippe Guégan is known for his work on Taken (2008), From Paris with Love (2010) and The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 1 (2014).
biography.name: Philippe Guégan

biography.bio: Hans E. Schons was born on September 5, 1919 in Malmédy, Belgium as Peter Hans Ewald Schons. He was an actor, known for Das mittlere Fenster (1959), Die Probe oder Die bestrafte Liebe (1963) and Das große ABC (1957). He was married to Dagmar Altrichter. He died on August 3, 2005 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Hans E. Schons

biography.bio: Hans Waldherr was born on February 9, 1921 in Budapest, Hungary as Hans Walter von Waldherr. He is an actor, known for Premières lueurs de l'aube (1967), Superbug, Super Agent (1972) and The Violin Case Murders (1965).
biography.name: Hans Waldherr

biography.bio: Heidi Leupolt is an actress, known for Faust (1960), Elsa Brändström (1971) and The Violin Case Murders (1965).
biography.name: Heidi Leupolt

biography.bio: Franz Rudnick was born on October 13, 1931 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for Marianne & Juliane (1981), Lacombe, Lucien (1974) and Soko, brigade des stups (1978). He was married to Susanne von Loessl. He died on October 13, 2005 in Munich, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Franz Rudnick

biography.bio: Robert Rathke is an actor, known for Der Mantel (1963), Münchhausen (1966) and The Violin Case Murders (1965).
biography.name: Robert Rathke

biography.bio: Richard Münch was born on January 10, 1916 in Giessen, Germany. He was an actor, known for Patton (1970), The Longest Day (1962) and Le train (1964). He was married to Ella Büchi. He died on June 6, 1987 in Malaga, Spain.
biography.name: Richard Münch

filmingLocations.location: New York City, New York, USA
